intro: Hieracium serratifrons subsp. canipes, commonly known as the serrated hawkweed, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Asteraceae. It is characterized by its upright growth habit and hairy stems, with leaves that are serrated and lance-shaped. The plant produces yellow flowers in composite flower heads, typical of the daisy family. It is native to Europe and is often found in meadows and grasslands. Due to its ornamental value, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens.
